noun.description: A small ornamental case, typically made of gold or silver, worn around a person's neck on a chain and used to hold things of sentimental value, such as a photograph or lock of hair.
A metal plate or band on a scabbard.

origin: Late Middle English (in locket (sense 2)): from Old French locquet, diminutive of loc latch, lock, of Germanic origin; related to lock. locket (sense 1) dates from the late 17th century.
